title: I haven't read a single book in two years and I keep getting told to start again. Why is reading books so important? - Quora

response.answer_text: Reading (especially reading for pleasure) is important for numerous practical reasons, but here are some obvious ones to start:— Expands vocabulary and improves spellingHelps understand different ways of life of different timesHelps understand different ideas.Improves communication effectivenessHelps find other people like ourselvesUpdates our knowledge and know-howExpands imagination, therefore ability to conceptualiseKnow what others know, therefore avoid repeating their mistakes and experimentsIncreases your “cultural literacy” — the ability to make out the nuances of cultures and rituals of other communities, civilisations and places that one has never been toImproves decision-makingIn line with reading, writing is equally important. Writing allows thoughts ‘trapped’ in your mind to come out and take shape. Your ideas therefore go beyond just talking and become more durable or permanent. From the British government: Research evidence on reading for pleasure. (Originally answered November 15, 2014 — fixed formatting glitches August 2, 2020.)

Reading books puts you into situations you wouldn't otherwise live through yourself, and introduces you to people you wouldn't otherwise meet. And good books give you a new understanding of those circumstances and characters.  By (vicariously) giving yourself those experiences, you can not only understand yourself better, but understand the thoughts and motivations behind other lives.  Approaching the world from that position of understanding, either logical or emotional, broadens your spirit -- even long after you've put that book down.
